edu.OOSE.cs.jhu.group2.PopZombiesUI

Interface Graphics


  • public interface Graphics
    Graphics interface that manages the graphics and drawing. Created with refence to http://www.kilobolt.com/game-development-tutorial.html
    Author:
    kilobolt, Connie Chang, Elaine Chao, Stephanie Chew, Ted Stanley, Kevin Zhang

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  Graphics.ImageFormat
      The three types of image formats.

        format - The desired format of the image

        y - Starting Y

      • drawRect

        void drawRect(int x,
            int y,
            int width,
            int height,
            int color)
        Draws a rectangle.
        Parameters:
        x - The left X coordinate
        y - The top Y coordinate
        width - The width of rectangle
        height - The height of rectangle
        color - The color of rectangle

      • drawImage

        void drawImage(Image image,
             int x,
             int y,
             int srcX,
             int srcY,
             int srcWidth,
             int srcHeight)
        Draws an image.
        Parameters:
        image - The image to be drawn
        x - the x position of the image
        y - the y position of the image
        srcX - where to put scale on screen in x
        srcY - where to put scale on screen in y
        srcWidth - scale the width of image
        srcHeight - scale the height of image

      • drawImage

        void drawImage(Image Image,
             int x,
             int y)
        Overloaded method to draw the image in 2D
        Parameters:
        Image - the image to be drawn
        x - the x position of the image
        y - the y position of the image

      • drawString

        void drawString(java.lang.String text,
              int x,
              int y,
              Paint paint)
        Puts text onto the screen.
        Parameters:
        text - to print out onto screen
        x - the x position of the text
        y - the y position of the text
        paint - object that will put text up

      • getWidth

        Gets the width of the screen

      • drawARGB

        void drawARGB(int i,
            int j,
            int k,
            int l)
        Draws the color on the screen
        Parameters:
        i - the alpha component of the color to draw
        j - the red component
        k - the green component
        l - the blue component
